title: Who is Nahid Islam, soft-spoken sociology student leader behind fall of Bangladesh government
Who was Sheikh Mujibur Rahman? Architect of independent Bangladesh
content: Amid political unrest in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and sought refuge in India. This situation mirrors her earlier exile nearly 48 years ago, following the assassination of her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, along with his family. Rahman was Bangladesh's first president, whose death in a military coup led to successive coups and power struggles.
summary: Amid political unrest in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and sought refuge in India. This situation mirrors her earlier exile nearly 48 years ago, following the assassination of her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, along with his family. Rahman was Bangladesh's first president, whose death in a military coup led to successive coups and power struggles.

title: How Israel's Mossad took down enemy with Belgian chocolates and toothpaste laced with poison
Caught on camera: Pickup truck slams into pedestrians on NYC sidewalk
content: A shocking event took place in Harlem when a pickup truck lost control, mounted the sidewalk, and struck two pedestrians. The incident occurred around 4:50 p.m. at the intersection of St. Nicholas Avenue and West 148th Street. Both victims were hospitalized and are in stable condition, while the driver remained uninjured and on the scene.
summary: A shocking event took place in Harlem when a pickup truck lost control, mounted the sidewalk, and struck two pedestrians. The incident occurred around 4:50 p.m. at the intersection of St. Nicholas Avenue and West 148th Street. Both victims were hospitalized and are in stable condition, while the driver remained uninjured and on the scene.

title: Kamala Harris makes history: Secures Democratic nomination as first woman of color on major party ticket
'Making too many smart people stupid': Joe Rogan's new special on trans, Covid criticised by critics
content: Joe Rogan's new Netflix special, "Burn the Boats," faced criticism for mocking transgender people and questioning COVID-19 vaccines. The podcaster defended his controversial views and opposed society's acceptance of trans people in certain spaces. The special drew harsh reactions and ignited debates over his comments on transgender issues and vaccine skepticism.
summary: Joe Rogan's new Netflix special, "Burn the Boats," faced criticism for mocking transgender people and questioning COVID-19 vaccines. The podcaster defended his controversial views and opposed society's acceptance of trans people in certain spaces. The special drew harsh reactions and ignited debates over his comments on transgender issues and vaccine skepticism.

title: Elon Musk's X to close San Francisco office, ending Twitter's 20-year presence
Hurricane Debbyâ€™s unexpected find: $1 million in cocaine found on Florida beach amidst hurricane aftermath
content: Hurricane Debby, which hit Florida on Monday, resulted in the surprising discovery of 25 packages of cocaine on a Florida Keys beach. A concerned citizen alerted authorities, leading to the confiscation of the $1 million worth of drugs. This follows a similar find in July when Tampa's mayor discovered cocaine during a vacation.
summary: Hurricane Debby, which hit Florida on Monday, resulted in the surprising discovery of 25 packages of cocaine on a Florida Keys beach. A concerned citizen alerted authorities, leading to the confiscation of the $1 million worth of drugs. This follows a similar find in July when Tampa's mayor discovered cocaine during a vacation.

title: $950 million fine for funeral home fraud: Is this enough for families whose loved ones were left to rot?
content: Jon and Carie Hallford, owners of Colorado funeral home 'Return to Nature,' were ordered to pay $950 million to families deceived by their fraudulent practices. Charged with corpse abuse and theft, they face further legal action. The ruling aims to bring understanding and accountability, as Colorado lawmakers push for stricter funeral home regulations.
summary: Jon and Carie Hallford, owners of Colorado funeral home 'Return to Nature,' were ordered to pay $950 million to families deceived by their fraudulent practices. Charged with corpse abuse and theft, they face further legal action. The ruling aims to bring understanding and accountability, as Colorado lawmakers push for stricter funeral home regulations.

title: Prince William 'spitting mad' at brother Harry, but why?
content: Prince William reportedly expressed anger towards Prince Harry for bringing up Princess Diana in recent interviews. Harry mentioned Diana's experiences with media hacking, but William is upset over what he sees as Harry's continuous exploitation of their mother's memory since marrying Meghan. This tension further strains their relationship and impacts Royal Family dynamics.
summary: Prince William reportedly expressed anger towards Prince Harry for bringing up Princess Diana in recent interviews. Harry mentioned Diana's experiences with media hacking, but William is upset over what he sees as Harry's continuous exploitation of their mother's memory since marrying Meghan. This tension further strains their relationship and impacts Royal Family dynamics.

title: Virginia man's chilling death threats against Kamala Harris exposed in FBI investigation
Gunmen kill New Zealand helicopter pilot in Indonesia's Papua, indigenous passengers freed
content: In Indonesia's Papua region, gunmen, allegedly from the West Papua Liberation Army, killed New Zealand pilot Glen Malcolm Conning after landing in Mimika district. The helicopter was set ablaze while Indigenous Papuan passengers were released. The attackers retreated into the jungle. The incident has heightened tensions between Indigenous Papuans and Indonesian authorities.
summary: In Indonesia's Papua region, gunmen, allegedly from the West Papua Liberation Army, killed New Zealand pilot Glen Malcolm Conning after landing in Mimika district. The helicopter was set ablaze while Indigenous Papuan passengers were released. The attackers retreated into the jungle. The incident has heightened tensions between Indigenous Papuans and Indonesian authorities.

title: Tropical storm Debby ravages Florida and Georgia: Many dead, cities flooded
content: Tropical Storm Debby caused severe damage across the southeastern US, leading to several deaths, mass evacuations, and extensive flooding. Rescue operations are ongoing in Florida and Georgia, with over 500 people saved from flooded homes. Power outages affected more than 300,000 people as authorities urged residents to stay vigilant, with the storm still posing significant threats.
summary: Tropical Storm Debby caused severe damage across the southeastern US, leading to several deaths, mass evacuations, and extensive flooding. Rescue operations are ongoing in Florida and Georgia, with over 500 people saved from flooded homes. Power outages affected more than 300,000 people as authorities urged residents to stay vigilant, with the storm still posing significant threats.

US passes message to Iran not to escalate at 'critical moment' for Middle East
content: The U.S. urged other nations to convey to Iran that escalating Middle East tensions isn't in their interest. Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the need for restraint and diplomacy, amid fears of Iranian retaliation against Israel following the assassinations of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders. President Biden and Vice President Harris were briefed on the situation and U.S. response efforts.
summary: The U.S. urged other nations to convey to Iran that escalating Middle East tensions isn't in their interest. Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the need for restraint and diplomacy, amid fears of Iranian retaliation against Israel following the assassinations of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders. President Biden and Vice President Harris were briefed on the situation and U.S. response efforts.
